body.name: Dane's Mark (A Novel of the Breeds Book 33)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Evoking mixed emotions
reviews.reviewText: Gave it 5 stars as it did what a book should do as it was entertaining and evoked multiple reactions. While the mating was an integral part of the story line, the out of left field female annoyed me. Not the character but the close relationship to prominent breed characters. I hate when a character is added at such an immense part of a previous characters life but there has never been mention of them what so ever. I do like the revelations and what could come from them but here again I have so many questions. I thought breeds could only reproduce with their mates? If so, how did 3 female hybrids with genetic flaming come to be, including the female mate character? And of course as one reader was afraid of the whole pining for Harmony was basically wiped away. Very small reference to it as it was poopooed away as nothing when the ongoing story line was him hiding and pining. Ugh, And how did Callen suddenly appear when he was not anywhere near Broken Butte? Time travel? All in all if you are a breed fan you need to read this book. Lots of history revealed and a future that is most definitely going to be full of challenges.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely amazing! Potential spoilers?
reviews.reviewText: When the book prior to this one was published and nothing came after I was sad because it couldn't end that way. At least in my mind. This story about Dane and Katelyn was heartbreaking, loving, adventurous and the mystery behind who the new threat is had me reading this book in less than a day! From the way the storyline went I'm hoping that we get more books! The way its written I feel as if I can visit every place and get to meet these amazing people. The dangers the breeds face are no less than what they were six years ago, but now the risks are higher and finding a mate seems both impossible and imperative. I secretly have my fingers crossed that we can see a book for David!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was sooo good, I hated to put it down before I finished. Katy had know Dane for several years and was attracted to him, but she was too young for him and he thought he would never mate. He couldn't tell she was his mate. When they finally got together 8 years later, they slept together, but no mating occured. It was only when she saw him with someone else, she collapsed in pain. Graeme almost killed her to spare her the pain and it was killing him as he loved her as a daughter. I won't tell anymore so I won't spoil the surprise, but this book is excellent and well worth your time

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Danes story has been a long time coming and I would have never guessed who his mate would have been or what she would be to him. I'm actually surprised at the ending. Looking forward to the next. Just wish danes story would have been longer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Just when you think you understand all the secrets of the Breeds and their mating heat WAM!!!! Another curve ball and a shock to the system!!! LOL 😂 This story was amazing. Many things going on and new characters that lead your mind into the what if's that could be leading to new stories?? I am so happy Dane got his story told and that we finally see him with someone else instead of following his old lover around like a lost puppy...really couldn't picture him like that any more...Glad his story leads to more future entertainment from the Breeds. Can't wait to know what happens next and who will be next in getting a mate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well worth the wait!
reviews.reviewText: This book was everything I expected it to be. Katy is an amazing female lead always teased as being more, and Dane well we have known him since the very early books as the spoiled heir of the Vanderale Empire. This book didn't disappoint bringing in familiar names from previous books was nice to see as well the character of Graeme Parker to stir things up is always interesting. The new characters promise to be fun shining a light on some of the complex history of the breeds that I didn't see coming. This book was worth the wait and most definitely fun reading. Enjoy everyone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A must read for all breed fans!!!
reviews.reviewText: This is a definite must read. From twists and turns to plots unseen a definite must in the series for breeds. Danes love story with his mate is epic to the extreme. Have waited several years for this book and for her to bring this story to a cliff hanger such as this was one to die for. The fact she expanded the facts of the beginning to the breads and the revel of some new fact is one that I cannot wait to read more on. I cannot wait for more in all of this but just have to wait. If you are a breed fan you will want to read this through.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The past is upon us
reviews.reviewText: I always knew Dane would end up having an epic tale, and I was not disappointed. The author not only told the story of a love greater than time and death, but she took the opportunity to explain the past and open new avenues for the future. I absolutely love Katy! She is strong, sweet, and resilient, with a core of true grit and grace that is hard to maintain with the life she has lived. And Dane finally lets his carefully crafted facade slip to reveal the loving, gentle soul buried within. Together with the support of some unexpected characters, these two have ushered in a new life for the Breeds. I can’t wait to see what happens next and read all about the loves that are sure to follow.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It’s been a long time and so worth the wait.This continues further along in the breeds timeline and explains so much more than we knew before. I presume from the way this progressed there will be more to come with a few new characters mixed in this tale. It’s a HEA addition.

A long wait but I do reread this series.Like the new direction.No spoilers but I read it after rereading from Jonas story and it all fitted together beautifully.After finishing I mulled it over and listened to the audible.So well narrated and I really enjoyed it.So Lora Leigh well done!

I read this book in one sitting, with only short breaks for necessities, and I so enjoyed diving back into the world of the Breeds and reading Dane’s story, a character I’ve long been fascinated with. The only issue that I have with this book is that I want more. I feel like I didn’t get enough story. I can’t wait for the next one, whenever it comes.
